last_episode_to_air.name: The Peacemakers, Iraq
last_episode_to_air.overview: In the violent aftermath of the Iraq War, four human rights activists from Christian Peacemaker Teams are taken hostage by insurgents in Baghdad.

name: Captive
overview: Documentary series reconstructing history's most complex, high-stakes hostage negotiations as kidnapping victims recount their terrifying ordeals.

episodes.name: Prison Riot, U.S.A.
episodes.overview: On Easter Sunday in 1993, inmates at a maximum security prison in Lucasville, Ohio, riot and take eight guards hostage, leading to a 10-day standoff.

episodes.name: Cola Kidnap, Brazil
episodes.overview: During a wave of kidnappings in early-1990s Brazil, a local Coca-Cola bottling executive is ambushed at gunpoint and held for a ransom of millions.

episodes.name: Taken at Sea, Somalia
episodes.overview: Sailing the Indian Ocean on their yacht, British couple Paul and Rachel Chandler are kidnapped by Somali pirates and held for an exorbitant ransom.

episodes.name: American Missionaries, Philippines
episodes.overview: The long captivity of American missionaries Martin and Gracia Burnham by Philippine terror group Abu Sayyaf takes on new urgency after 9/11.

episodes.name: British Aid Workers, Chechnya
episodes.overview: A pair of British aid workers establishing a children's rehab center in war-torn Chechnya are taken prisoner and held for a year.

episodes.name: Bethlehem Siege, Palestine
episodes.overview: When Israeli forces invade Bethlehem in 2002, dozens of Palestinians take refuge in the Church of the Nativity, sparking a monthlong standoff.

episodes.name: Al Qaeda Hostages, Yemen
episodes.overview: Pierre and Yolande Korkie relocate from South Africa to Yemen to perform charitable work, but tragedy follows when they are kidnapped by Al Qaeda.

episodes.name: The Peacemakers, Iraq
episodes.overview: In the violent aftermath of the Iraq War, four human rights activists from Christian Peacemaker Teams are taken hostage by insurgents in Baghdad.
